purpleculture_pinyin:
qì
gas; air; smell; weather; to make angry; to annoy; to get angry; vital energy; qi
газ; воздуха; запах; Погода; рассердить; раздражать; сердиться; жизненная энергия; ци
rtega_mnemonic:
氣氣RS
气气		steam, vapor, spirit, rad. 84
  • rising steam or mist → 气
  • steaming 气 freshly cooked rice 米
  • the spirit is floating over the water like steam
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 气)
Ideographic: A person 亻 breathing air 米
purpleculture_examples:
氣氛 [ qì fēn ]: atmosphere; mood
氣候 [ qì hòu ]: climate; atmosphere; situation; Classifiers: 种
氣象 [ qì xiàng ]: meteorological feature; Classifiers: 个 ; meteorology; atmosphere; ambience; scene
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿹ Surround from upper right
    • 气 [ qì ] air, gas; steam, vapor; anger
    • 米 [ mǐ ] rice, millet, grain
heisig_chinese_memo: After the fishing competition the fisherman throw down their fishhooks, reclining on the floor to catch some air, and eat rice because they are so tired.
Ru_trainchinese:
qì: (сущ/глаг) газ; воздух; дыхание; злиться, сердиться; злить, выводить из себя
qì: (сущ) (кит. мед.) ци, чи (активная субстанция, которая является частью любого живого организма)
qì: (графема) погода; запах; дух, настроение; стиль, манеры; обида, оскорбление
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the steam (气) from the rice (米) is its spirit
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: At night I hang the fishhook on the wall, recline floor bed and take a deep breath of fresh air before relaxing.
origin_of_ch_char_book: When fall came and the dew in the fields would evaporate in the early sunshine, people could often see morning fog. They thought of that morning fog as the breath of the earth. (氣, 气, qi=ch’i, gas; air) The character shows vapor rising from the earth. Flowing water looks like this: (水, shui, water). But compared to flowing water, this character shows stillness.,Later, people added the character symbolizing hot steam coming from rice (米, mi, rice) that is being cooked 氣 (qi=ch’i). But in the 1950s, the simplified Chinese characters policy changed 氣 (qi) to its original form: 气 (qi).
humanum_full_description_en: "Shuowen": "Qi, feed the guest to savour rice. From the sound of the rice. "Chunqiu Chuan" says: "Qi people come from Qi to all the 矦." Qi, Qi or from 旣. Fu, Qi or from food. "Wang Mingsheng" Moshu Bian": "The word "Qi" is changed, replacing "Qi" with "Qi"... "Qi" is discarded and not used." Today " Qi " is again adopted as the simplified character of " Qi ", see " Qi " and "饩".
humanum_short_description_en: " Qi ", the variant is also called "饩" and "䊠". The original meaning is food presented to people. Later, the word "饩" is used to express this specific meaning, and " qi " means air, cloud air, air current, breath, etc.
humanum_full_description: 《說文》：「氣，饋客芻米也。从米气聲。《春秋傳》曰：『齊人來氣諸矦。』䊠，氣或从旣。餼，氣或从食。」王鳴盛《蛾術編》：「『气』字隸變，以『氣』代『气』…『气』廢而不用」。今天「气」復又被採納為「氣」之簡體字，參見「气」、「餼」。
humanum_short_description: 「氣」，異體亦作「餼」、「䊠」，本義為贈送給人的糧食，後以「餼」字表此專義，而「氣」表示空氣、雲氣、氣流、氣息等。

origin_of_ch_char_book: When fall came and the dew in the fields would evaporate in the early sunshine, people could often see morning fog. They thought of that morning fog as the breath of the earth. (氣, 气, qi=ch’i, gas; air) The character shows vapor rising from the earth. Flowing water looks like this: (水, shui, water). But compared to flowing water, this character shows stillness.,Later, people added the character symbolizing hot steam coming from rice (米, mi, rice) that is being cooked 氣 (qi=ch’i). But in the 1950s, the simplified Chinese characters policy changed 氣 (qi) to its original form: 气 (qi).

  • ⿹ Surround from upper right
    • 气 [ qì ] air, gas; steam, vapor; anger

①沒有一定的形狀、體積，能自由散佈的物體：氣體。
②呼吸：沒氣了。氣厥。氣促。氣息。一氣呵成。
③自然界寒、曖、陰、晴等現象：氣候。氣溫。氣象。
④鼻子聞到的味：氣味。臭氣。
⑤人的精神狀態：氣概。氣節。氣魄。氣派。氣餒。
⑥怒，或使人發怒：不要氣我了。氣惱。氣盛(shéng)。忍氣吞聲。
⑦欺壓：受氣。
⑧中醫指能使人體器官發揮機能的動力：氣功。氣血。氣虛。
⑨中醫指某種症象：痰氣。溼氣。
⑩景象：和氣。氣氛。氣韻(文章或書法繪畫的意境或韻味)。

《說文》：「氣，饋客芻米也。从米气聲。《春秋傳》曰：『齊人來氣諸矦。』䊠，氣或从旣。餼，氣或从食。」王鳴盛《蛾術編》：「『气』字隸變，以『氣』代『气』…『气』廢而不用」。今天「 气 」復又被採納為「 氣 」之簡體字，參見「 气 」、「 餼 」。
"Shuowen": "Qi, feed the guest to savour rice. From the sound of the rice. "Chunqiu Chuan" says: "Qi people come from Qi to all the 矦." Qi, Qi or from 旣. Fu, Qi or from food. "Wang Mingsheng" Moshu Bian": "The word "Qi" is changed, replacing "Qi" with "Qi"... "Qi" is discarded and not used." Today " Qi" is again adopted as the simplified character of " Qi", see " Qi" and " 饩".

氣字的基本解释

氣
qì
见“气”。

氣字的汉语字典释义

[①]［qì］
［《廣韻》去既切，去未，溪。］
“炁1”的今字。“气1”的繁体字。
(1)云气。
(2)蜃气。
(3)空气。
(4)指气体。
(5)气象。
(6)节气；气候。
(7)气味。
(8)嗅，闻。
(9)呼吸；气息。
(10)声气，语气。
(11)景象；气氛。
(12)指社会风气和习俗。
(13)指人、物的属性或一地的天然特点。
(14)中国古代哲学概念。主观唯心主义者用以指主观精神。《孟子·公孙丑下》：“我善養吾浩然之氣。”宋代及以后的客观唯心主义者认为“气”是一种在“理”（即精神）之后的物质。宋朱熹《答黄道夫》：“天地之間，有理有氣。理也者，形而上之道也，生物之本也；氣也者，形而下之器也，生物之具也。是以人物之生必稟此理，然後有性；必稟此氣，然後有形。”明何景明《内篇》之二十：“氣者，形之御也。氣以神動，形以氣存，不存而存，故曰難老。”朴素唯物主义者则用以指形成宇宙万物的最根本的物质实体。《易·繫辞上》：“精氣爲物，遊魂爲變。”孔颖达疏：“'精氣爲物'者，謂陰陽精靈之氣。”汉王充

氣字的康熙字典解释

【辰集下】【气字部】　氣； 康熙笔画：10； 页码：页599第12
〔古文〕?【唐韻】去旣切【集韻】【韻會】【類篇】丘旣切，?音气。【玉篇】?也，息也。【文子·守弱篇】形者，生之舍也。氣者，生之元也。【易·乾卦】同氣相求。【繫辭】精氣爲物。【禮·月令】孟春之月，天氣下降，地氣上騰。又【祭義】氣也者，神之盛也。【註】氣謂噓吸出入者也。　又天氣曰元氣。【後漢·明帝紀】升靈臺，望元氣。【註】元氣，天氣也。　又陰陽曰二氣。【太極圖說】二氣交感，化生萬物。　又五氣。【史記·五帝紀】炎帝修德振兵，治五氣。【註】王肅曰：五氣，五方之氣。又【書·洪範·曰雨曰暘曰燠曰寒曰風註】雨木氣，暘金氣，燠火氣，寒水氣，風土氣爲五氣。又【素問】寒熱風燥濕，五氣之聚也。寒生水，熱生火，風生木，燥生金，濕生土。　又六氣。【左傳·昭元年】六氣：隂陽風雨晦明也。又【莊子·逍遙遊】乗天地之正，而御六氣之辨。【註】平旦爲朝霞，日中爲正陽，日入爲飛泉，夜半爲沆瀣，與天?地黃爲六氣。【王逸·楚辭註】《陵陽子明經》春食朝霞，日欲出時黃氣也。秋食淪隂，日沒已後赤

氣字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
氣字的起名意思

暂无。

gas
Basic explanation of words
gas
qì
See "qi".
gas
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［qì］
["Guangyun" goes to Jiqie, goes to Wei, Xi. ]
The present word for "Qi 1". Traditional characters for "气1".
(1) Yunqi.
(2) Mirage.
(3) Air.
(4) Refers to gas.
(5) Meteorology.
(6) Solar terms; climate.
(7) Odor.
(8) Smell and smell.
(9) Breath; breath.
(10) Voice, tone.
(11) Scenery; atmosphere.
(12) Refers to social customs and customs.
(13) Refers to the attributes of people and things or the natural characteristics of a place.
(14) Ancient Chinese philosophical concepts. Subjective idealists are used to refer to the subjective spirit. "Mencius·Gongsun Chouxia": "I am good at nurturing my awe-inspiring aura." The objective idealists in the Song Dynasty and later believed that "qi" is a substance after "li" (that is, spirit). Song Zhuxi's "Answer to Huang Daofu": "Between heaven and earth, there is reason and qi. The person who is rational, the metaphysical way is also the foundation of living things; the person who qi is also the metaphysical device, and the equipment of living things. It is the birth of characters. This principle must be given up, and then there will be sex; this qi must be given up, and then tangible." Ming He Jingming "Inner Chapter" 20: "The person who is qi is the prince of the shape. The qi moves by the spirit, and the shape is stored by the qi, but not there. But to survive, it is hard to grow old." The naive materialists are used to refer to the most fundamental material entities that form everything in the universe. "Essence of the Essence": "Essence is a thing, and the wandering soul is a change." Kong Yingdashu: "'Essence is a thing', it is called the spirit of yin and yang." Han Wangchong
gas
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Chen Jixia] [Qi Zi Department] 　 Qi; Kangxi strokes: 10; Page number: Page 599 No. 12
[Ancient text]? [Tang Yun] Go to 旣切 [Jiyun] [Yunhui] [Classes] Qiu 旣切,? Tone. [Jade articles]? Yeah, breathe. 【Wenzi·Keep the Weak Article】Shaped person is also the home of life. The anger is the origin of life. [Yi·Qian Gua] Seek the same spirit. 【Comment】Essence is a thing. [Rite·Moon Order] In the month of Meng Chun, the weather dropped, and the earth's gas rose. Also 【Sacrifice to Righteousness】The one who is angry is also the prosperity of God. [Note] Qi means that those who breathe in and out.　The weather is vigorous again. [Later Han·Ming Emperor Ji] Ascension platform, looking for vitality. 【Note】Vitality and weather.　Yin and Yang call two Qi. [Tai Chi Illustrated] Two qi sympathizes, metamorphosing everything.　Five spirits again. 【Historical Records·The Five Emperors】Yan Emperor cultivated virtue and revitalized his troops to cure the five qi. [Note] Wang Su said: Five qi, five directions of qi. Also【Book·Hongfan·Yueyuyueyueyueyueyueyueyueyueyueyuehanyuefengfeng Note】Yumuqi, Yangjinqi, Liaohuqi, cold water and wind are five qi. [Su Wen] Cold, hot, wind, and dampness, the gathering of the five qi. Cold produces water, heat produces fire, wind produces wood, dryness produces gold, and damp soil.　Also six qi. [Zuo Zhuan·First Year of Zhao] Six Qi: Yin and Yang, wind and rain are also obscure. Also [Zhuangzi·Xiaoyaoyou] Take advantage of the righteousness of heaven and earth, and the distinction of imperial six qi. [Note] Pingdan is the morning glow, the sun is the positive sun, the sun enters as the flying spring, and the midnight is the holy gloom, and the sky and the earth are the six qi. [Annotation to Wang Yi·Chu Ci] "Lingyang Zi Ming Jing" spring eclipse and morning glow, yellow air when the sun is about to emerge. The autumn food is overcast, the day is gone and the last is red
